intro: Lobelia hillebrandii var. monostachya, commonly known as the Hawaiian lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
